titleStmt.title: The first booke of cattell wherein is shewed the gouernment of oxen, kine, calues, and how to vse bulles and other cattell to the yoake, and fell. With diuers approued remedies, to helpe most diseases among cattell: most necessarie for all, especially for husband men, hauing the gouernment of any such cattell. Gathered and set forth by Leonard Mascall.
Government of cattell
titleStmt.author: Mascall, Leonard, d. 1589.

notesStmt.note: The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A".

"The second booke intreating of the gouernment of horses" and "The third booke intreating of the ordering of sheep and goatees [sic], hogs and dogs" each have separate dated title page; register and pagination are continuous.
The five pages after 257 are numbered [unnumbered], 258, 259, [unnumbered], [unnumbered]. Pages 293-301 are numbered 193, 298, 289, 196, [unnumbered], 196, 197, 285.
Later editions published with title: The government of cattell.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
